bayou.od

Class OD.BindingBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.od.OD.BindingBuilder<T>
  • Enclosing class:
    OD

    public static final class OD.BindingBuilder<T>
extends Object
    Builder for creating bindings.

    A BindingBuilder is started by OD.bind(ClassType) or OD.Local.bind(ClassType), finished by one of the to(...) methods, for example, 

         OD.bind(Foo.class).to(foo);

     OD.Local.bind(Bar.class).to(BarImpl::new);

    The to(...) method creates a Binding, adds it to the global or local binding list, depending how the builder was started.

    Tags - By default, the binding exact-matches empty tags. You can specify exact-matching of tags by tags(Object...) 

         OD.bind(Foo.class).tags(tag1, tag2).to(foo);
     ...
     OD.get(Foo.class, tag1, tag2);   // sees `foo`

    See also tagsMatch(OD.Predicate) for arbitrary tag matching algorithm.

    • Method Summary

      Specify exact-matching tags.

    • Method Detail

      • tags

        public OD.BindingBuilder<T> tags(Object... tags)
        Specify exact-matching tags.

        This method is equivalent to tagsMatch(OD.Predicate) with a predicate that matches exactly the given `tags`.

        Exact-match of two objects are defined by Object.equals(Object); also, `null` exact-matches `null`.

        Returns:
        `this` for method chaining

      • tagsMatch

        public OD.BindingBuilder<T> tagsMatch(OD.Predicate<Object[]> predicate)
        Specify how tags will be matched.

        The tags in `OD.get(type,tags)` will be fed to `predicate` to check whether they match this binding. For example, to specify that the binding matches any lookup tags 

             OD.bind(Foo.class).tagsMatch(tags->true).to(foo);
        Returns:
        `this` for method chaining

      • to

        public OD.Binding to(T instance)
        Create a Binding to a single instance.

        This method is equivalent to to(OD.Supplier) with a supplier that always returns `instance`.

        Returns:
        the Binding created

      • to

        public OD.Binding to(OD.Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
        Create a Binding to a supplier of T.

        The supplier will be invoke for every `OD.get()` call that matches this binding. For example, 

             OD.bind(Foo.class).to(FooImpl::new);
        Returns:
        the Binding created

      • to

        public OD.Binding to(Class<? extends T> implClass)
        Create a Binding to an implementation class of T.

        In simple cases, the zero-arg constructor of `implClass` will be invoked for each `OD.get()`. For example 

             OD.bind(Foo.class).to(FooImpl.class);

     OD.get(Foo.class); // invokes and returns `new FooImpl()`
        Returns:
        the Binding created
